acabf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
acabf_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux

agesno_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
agesno_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.
hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land

hfgeoubed_tavg-u-hxy-gis.long_name: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

hfgeoubed_ti-u-hxy-gis.long_name: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
hfss_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux

iareafl_tavg-u-hm-fis.cell_methods: area: sum where floating_ice_shelf (mask=sftflf) time: mean
iareafl_tavg-u-hm-fis.long_name: Area Covered by Floating Ice Shelves

iareagr_tavg-u-hm-fis.cell_methods: area: sum where grounded_ice_sheet (mask=sfgrlf) time: mean
iareagr_tavg-u-hm-fis.long_name: Area Covered by Grounded Ice Sheet

icem_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
icem_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Ice Melt Flux

libmassbffl_tavg-u-hxy-fis.comment: quantity averaged over floating land ice
libmassbffl_tavg-u-hxy-fis.long_name: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf

libmassbfgr_tavg-u-hxy-gis.comment: quantity averaged over grounded land ice
libmassbfgr_tavg-u-hxy-gis.long_name: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet

licalvf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front
lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux

lim_tavg-u-hm-is.cell_methods: area: sum where ice_sheet time: mean

limnsw_tavg-u-hm-is.cell_methods: area: sum where ice_sheet time: mean
limnsw_tavg-u-hm-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Mass That Does not Displace Sea Water

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.comment: quantity averaged over floating land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.long_name: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.comment: quantity averaged over grounded land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.long_name: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet

litemptop_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
litemptop_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model

lithk_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: This is needed in case ice sheet thickness changes in time

lithk_ti-u-hxy-is.comment: The thickness of the ice sheet

lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

modelCellAreai_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: When interpolated to a regular grid, it should be interpolated (not summed) with a conservative scheme to preserve total area
modelCellAreai_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model

mrfso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

mrroLi_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

mrro_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

orog_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

pflw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
pflw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "where land over land", i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
pflw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer

prra_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

prsnIs_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

prsn_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

rlds_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rlds_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation

rlus_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rlus_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sftflf_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

sftflf_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

sftgrf_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by grounded ice sheet

sftgrf_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

snc_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

snc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

snd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snicefreez_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
snicefreez_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux

snicem_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
snicem_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux

snm_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land_ice regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snm_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snm_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Computed as the total surface melt water on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux

snw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

sootsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sootsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

strbasemag_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Magnitude of basal drag at land ice base

tas_tavg-h2m-hm-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

tas_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

tendacabf_tavg-u-hm-is.cell_methods: area: sum where ice_sheet time: mean

tendlibmassbf_tavg-u-hm-is.cell_methods: area: sum where ice_sheet time: mean

tendlicalvf_tavg-u-hm-is.cell_methods: area: sum where ice_sheet time: mean

topg_tavg-u-hxy-gis.comment: This is needed in case bed rock elevation changes in time

tpf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tpf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: where land over land: This is the mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as missing in permafrost-free regions.

ts_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

tsn_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

tsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
tsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

xvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.
xvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity

xvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice
xvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity

xvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
xvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity

yvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.
yvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity

yvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice
yvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity

yvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'
yvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity

zvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). "basal" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
zvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity

zvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
zvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
